conclusion: Analyze forces to determine mass of block B.
Identify forces on block A: gravitational force, normal force, tension.
Resolve gravitational force on block A into components.
Normal force balances perpendicular gravitational component: N = mg cos 30°.
Tension balances parallel gravitational component: T = mg sin 30°.
Tension in rope for block B is split into two components: T = 2T_B.
Tension in each segment of rope equals weight of block B: T_B = m_B g.
Substitute T_B into tension equation: T = 2m_B g.
Equate tensions from block A and B: mg sin 30° = 2m_B g.
Solve for mass of block B: m_B = m/4.
